definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn

sentences.english: And we can tell,then, what sorts of books they included in their scripture.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以看看，聖典裏包括一些什麼書。

sentences.english: You have cleverly rationalized what the gurus and holy books have taught you.
sentences.chinese: 你很聰明地把古魯或者聖典上所教導的東西合理化了。

sentences.english: One of its first tasks was to outline a fixed canon.
sentences.chinese: 它的一種最初的急務就是編訂一本確定的聖典。

sentences.english: Most modern people say,"Why is this text scripture?
sentences.chinese: 現代大多數人會問“爲什麼這是聖典？

sentences.english: We rejoice in the sacrament that makes Hongzhou Huang and Xiaojing Zhang one.
sentences.chinese: 我們在這個使黃鴻洲與張皛晶合而爲一的聖典中歡欣。

sentences.english: Shi, is a drink praise tsu of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《孫子兵法》是一部飲譽世界的兵學聖典。

sentences.english: Therefore, we can see that it is misreading to regard "Indoctrination of Daughters" as an expression of ide…
sentences.chinese: 把《女誡》當作女教的聖典是對這部作品的誤讀。

sentences.english: Mary had her Magnificat,which sounds like scripture.
sentences.chinese: 馬利亞和她的《聖母頌歌》，聽起來很像聖典。

sentences.english: Why did the Gospel of Judas not make it into the canon?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼猶大福音沒有進入聖典？

sentences.english: I sat down on the couch and finally opened The Dawn Horse Testament.
sentences.chinese: 我就坐在長椅上翻閱，最後我打開了《黎明馬聖典》。

definition: Kumarajiva c. 334-413, Buddhist monk and translator of Zen texts
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
Nihonshoki or Chronicles of Japan (c. 720) book of mythology and history
Song Dynasty History of Zen Buddhism in China (1252), 20 scrolls
